actions: Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, moderates spasms, alleviates pain, harmonizes the Stomach, moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs and guides the herbs to all twelve channels.
Warms the Middle Jiao and alleviates pain.
Warms the Middle and expels Cold.
With Gao Liang Jiang, for abdominal Cold and vomiting due to Stomach Cold.
(Promotes the movement of Qi, transforms Dampness, strengthens the Spleen, stops vomiting, warms the Middle and stops diarrhea. Substitutes for Pao Jiang in some versions.)
Warms the Kidneys, Spleen and Heart, strengthens Yang and Ming Men Fire, disperses deep Cold, warms and unblocks the channels and vessels and alleviates pain.
Warms the Liver and Kidneys, expels Cold, regulates Qi, harmonizes the Stomach and alleviates pain.
Invigorates the Blood, circulates Qi and stops pain.
With Gao Liang Jiang and Pao Jiang, for abdominal pain due to Cold and Blood Stagnation.

syndromes: Spleen and Stomach Deficiency Cold with Qi and Blood Stagnation

symptoms: Cramps and pain in the epigastrium
Fullness and distention of the chest and hypochondrium

conditions.name: Generalized cramping and pain in the epigastric region

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with chest or abdominal pain due to inflammation.
